alert.note: Alert for City of Fairfax; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county: City of Fairfax and Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 AM EDT, Most streams have crested but Difficult Run remains above Flood Stage. 6 inches of flowing water is covering Browns Mill Road near Difficult Run. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reston... Fairfax... Vienna... Mantua... Potomac... Oakton... Chantilly... Tysons Corner... Wolf Trap... Great Falls... Merrifield... Dunn Loring... Belleview... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
